frequent_values: Corporation Counsel Names Susan Amron as the New Chief of the Environmental Law Division

New York Pension Funds Settle Countrywide Financial Corporation Litigation for $624 Million  (released in conjunction with the Office of the City Comptroller, the Office of the State Comptroller, and Labaton Sucharow, LLP.) (in PDF)
World Trade Center Insurance Fund Announces Settlement of 9/11 Rescue and Debris Removal Claims (Released by the Captive in Conjunction with the City and its Contractors)
City and EPA Reach Groundbreaking Agreement on Monitoring Possible PCB Caulk Exposure in City Schools

State's Highest Court Unanimously (7-0) Reverses Lower Court; Finds That City Can Apply 2007 Statute to Bar Engineer from Filing Any Documents with Buildings Department Based on False Filings He Made Before Effective Date of Statute

shortest_values: City Wins Tavern on the Green Trademark Case
City Wins Longstanding Case Involving Adult Use Zoning Laws
City to Extend Disabled Parking Program to Non-City Residents
City Regulation of Outdoor Advertising Deemed Constitutional
Court Finds City's Policing of Large Bike Groups Constitutional
longest_values: Federal Bar Council Honors Corporation Counsel Michael A. Cardozo with Prestigious Emory Buckner Medal; in Award’s Keynote Speech, Cardozo Offers Ideas on How to Provide Greater Attorney Training and Increase the Number of Public Sector Lawyers  (released in conjunction with the Federal Bar Council - their release available here. Find the related speech here. )  (in PDF)

Testimony of Michael A. Cardozo, Corporation Counsel of the City of New York, Before The House Committee on the Judiciary, Subcommittee on Immigration, Citizenship, Refugees, Border Security, and International Law And Subcommittee on the Constitution, Civil Rights, and Civil Liberties, On H.R. 847, The James Zadroga 9/11 Health and Compensation Act of 2009

Mayor Michael Bloomberg Proposes Overhaul of the New York State Juvenile Justice System to Improve Public Safety, Break the Cycle of Crime and Save Taxpayers Millions  (released in conjunction with the Office of the Mayor, the Administration for Children's Services, the Department of Probation and the National Action Network)

In Speech to Citizens Budget Commission, New York City Corporation Counsel Michael A. Cardozo Addresses Key New York City Legal Issues Involving Billions of Dollars and Much-Needed Reform Initiatives  (in PDF)  Full text of speech and accompanying charts linked in release.

Man Who Claims That He Was On The S.I. Ferry During The Tragic 2003 Crash - And Whom The City Alleges Wasn't - Loses Lawsuit; This Victory is an Example of How The City's Law Department and Department of Investigation Aggressively Pursue Fraudulent Cases
